title: ElegantNote
content:
Hugo uses Markdown for its simple content format. However, there are a lot of things that Markdown doesn’t support well. You could use pure HTML to expand possibilities.
But this happens to be a bad idea. Everyone uses Markdown because it’s pure and simple to read even non-rendered. You should avoid HTML to keep it as simple as possible.
To avoid this limitations, Hugo created shortcodes. A shortcode is a simple snippet inside a page.
Hugo-theme-learn provides multiple shortcodes on top of existing ones.

title: ElegantLaTeX
content:
ElegantLaTeX 
The ElegantLaTeX program is established in 2013 by Ethan Deng and Liam Huang. The first template is ElegantNote which is designed to simplify the work of taking notes. In the following years, ElegantNote is re-designed for notes, and ElegantBook is renewed as book template on the basis of original ElegantNote. Last year, we started the new project of ElegantPaper designed for writing working papers. The goal of ElegantLaTeX program to design elegant and beautiful LaTeX templates is unchanged these years.
Elegant LaTeX, Elegant Life.
Templates Now ElegantLaTeX consists of three templates.
 ElegantNote: An Elegant LaTeX Template for Notes; ElegantBook: An Elegant LaTeX Template for Books; ElegantPaper: An Elegant LaTeX Template for Working Papers.  links  Homepage: https://elegantlatex.org/ Github: https://github.com/ElegantLaTeX CTAN:  ElegantNote: tbu; ElegantBook: tbu; ElegantPaper: ver 0.02.
